availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William C. Reeder (Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Ohio native. Married to Elizabeth A. Shriver Reeder. Father of Jacob F. Reeder. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860. 1st Lieutenant and Captain in the 18th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from June 16, 1863, to April 4, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Falmouth, p. 2.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records â€“ Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994052, Pendleton County Births, p. 555-556.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 6.
Find A Grave, "Capt William C. Reeder (December 31, 1833-October 2, 1880)," Memorial #92827628, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/92827628 (accessed June 11, 2018).
